author: Bloomberg News
title: Chinese AI firm reports Q3 loss
text: Baidu Inc. recorded its biggest revenue drop in more than two years after China's economic malaise undermined its push into generative AI. Revenue for the three months ended September slipped 3% to $4.6 billion, in line with analysts' projections. Net income came to $1.04 billion. The results reflect how the Chinese internet search leader's AI-first growth strategy has delivered underwhelming returns so far. The company hopes its Ernie artificial intelligence model -- now handling 1.5 billion daily queries -- could become a game-changer for businesses like search and the cloud, but it will take time for monetization to fully kick in. Its Ernie Bot has fallen behind ByteDance Ltd.'s Doubao in China usage, while the core business is losing eyeballs to newer social platforms like Xiaohongshu and Douyin. Baidu's broader AI effort encompasses autonomous vehicles, an arena in which it's regarded as a pioneer. On Thursday, Baidu said it has begun operating the latest generation of Apollo Go driverless taxis in several cities, taking the cheaper model beyond the testing stage. Fully driverless vehicles -- those without safety personnel behind the wheel -- now account for 70% of Baidu's robotaxi rides across the country, it said. Baidu is among the companies most vulnerable to China's downturn, as its key advertisers span industries from automakers to real estate. Rivals Tencent Holdings Ltd. and Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. said they saw some improvement in the broader economy last week after posting mixed results, though neither offered a forecast for when a rebound might take hold. "So far in Q4, we have not observed a notable improvement in advertisers' spending patterns, and consumer spending remains subdued," longtime CFO Luo Rong, who's started a new role to head Baidu's mobile ecosystem, told analysts on a call. "Having said that, we are particularly encouraged by the strength and timeliness of recent stimulus policies which continue to be rolled out." Despite a head-start in China's AI frenzy, Baidu has struggled to hang on to leadership. Aside from no longer having the country's most popular AI chatbot, the company faces an all-out price war among AI infrastructure providers to entice more developers and startups as customers. Even after generative AI products contributed a bigger 11% of cloud revenue for the third quarter, Baidu's biggest growth engine slowed because of intensifying competition. "Despite the near-term pressures, we remain steadfast in our AI-focused strategy and are confident in our long-term trajectory," founder Robin Li said in a statement.

author: Staff Report
title: BAD TRAINING: Poorly Trained Recruits Contribute to Ukrainian Territorial Losses, Commanders Say
text:
Ukrainian commanders are expressing concern over poorly trained recruits, who they say are contributing to the loss of territory on the eastern front. Inexperienced soldiers, some of whom refuse to fire at the enemy or abandon their posts, have been linked to recent setbacks near the strategic city of Pokrovsk.
Commanders blame these losses on the rushed mobilization of new troops, who lack even basic combat training. Despite Ukraine‚Äôs recent incursions into Russia, its forces are struggling to hold ground against a better-equipped Russian army.
The situation has prompted commanders to call for improved training and better screening of recruits, as Ukrainian forces face mounting pressure in the region. The capture of Pokrovsk by Russian forces would be a significant blow to Ukraine‚Äôs defense efforts in the Donetsk region.

author: Rocco Parascandola, New York Daily News
title: Man accused of stabbing woman in neck while she worked at Manhattan migrant shelter | News | thebrunswicknews.com
text:
NEW YORK ‚Äî A 19-year-old man at a Manhattan shelter for migrants has been charged with stabbing a worker in the neck, police said Wednesday.
Jonathan Manu is charged with attempted murder, assault and weapon possession.

author: South Florida Caribbean News
title: Valorant Vs. CS: GO (CS-2) Which One‚Äôs Worth Playing in 2024?
text: [Sports](https://sflcn.com/category/sports/) Valorant Vs. CS: GO (CS-2) Which One‚Äôs Worth Playing in 2024? Valorant is a fully-fledged tactical FPS with a great mix of solid gunplay and over-the-top hero specific abilities. It‚Äôs a hybrid of a hero shooter like Overwatch combined with the strategy and tactical sensibilities of the OG of the genre, Counter-Strike. And it‚Äôs safe to say it‚Äôs taken the world by storm, with many players flocking from Counter-Strike to try their hand at Valorant (and sometimes failing). In 2024 though, we have to be a bit more conscious of the time spent on games and unfortunately we can‚Äôt excel at all of them. Fans of the tactical FPS genre may be confused on which one is truly worth diving into, especially in 2024. Considering that CS:GO recently revamped and upgraded itself with updated graphics, UI, and game mechanics, it‚Äôs a tough decision. So today we‚Äôre checking out the differences between the two to find the best game for you! And if you‚Äôre set on Valorant as your tactical FPS of choice, check out U7BUY to find [Valorant account for sale](https://www.u7buy.com/valorant/valorant-account) to unlock Agents instantly, get a higher rank, or rare weapon Valorant skins! The Biggest Difference b/w Valorant & Counter-Strike ‚Äì Agent Abilities Besides the most obvious difference of art style and aesthetic where Valorant is more animated and leans into the ‚Äòwhacky‚Äô, Counter-Strike is more geared towards realism and ‚Äòserious‚Äô. That‚Äôs not to say there isn‚Äôt fun to be had in [Counter-Strike](https://sflcn.com/which-csgo-trading-site-will-accept-cs2-skins/), but a major reason gamers gravitate toward Valorant is because of the intricate storyline and variety of Agent types which makes the game a bit more engaging than a boring & generic Terrorist or Counter-Terrorist character. But besides the aesthetic differences, another big difference between the two tactical FPS games are Valorant‚Äôs Agent abilities. Valorant has pre-defined roles and Agents within those roles have a variety of skills. This could range from damage dealing abilities, smokes, crowd-control skills, traps, and more. Matches in Valorant can be drastically different depending on the Agents selected which gives Valorant a bit of an advantage in terms of how matches play out and game variety. Are There Any Other Differences Between Counter-Strike and Valorant? The most major differences lie in the visual aspects, Agent abilities, and seasonal changes adding new Agents and lore to the universe. Besides these aspects though, Valorant and Counter-Strike are incredibly similar in terms of gameplay. For example, both are heavily skewed towards skilled play and rely on a player‚Äôs precision in landing the right shots at the right time. Both games also heavily rely on situational and environmental awareness to know where enemies are at all times. The weapon selection (while look drastically different) aren‚Äôt too far off either. Meaning, if you‚Äôve played either of the games before, you‚Äôre more than likely able to excel depending on your skill within the other game with those select weapons. Overall, while there are stark differences between the two, Valorant and Counter-Strike are both equally impressive tactical FPS games to dive into. It‚Äôs only really a matter of preference in terms of visual style, whether you prefer the ‚Äòhero‚Äô style characters, and Agent abilities adding a twist to the game. The good news is whether you prefer Valorant or Counter-Strike, U7BUY is packed with accounts and items for both, including a selection of [CSGO accounts](https://www.u7buy.com/counter-strike-2/counter-strike-2-accounts) to get you started!

title: Llama Cuba a detener los cr√≠menes internacionales de genocidio, lesa humanidad y apartheid que se cometen contra el pueblo palestino
text:
Nueva York, 1 de febrero de 2024.- Cuba conden√≥, en los t√©rminos m√°s en√©rgicos los asesinatos de civiles, especialmente de mujeres, ni√±os y de trabajadores humanitarios del sistema de Naciones Unidas; los bombardeos indiscriminados contra la poblaci√≥n en Gaza y la destrucci√≥n de viviendas, hospitales e infraestructura civil.
Tales acciones constituyen flagrantes violaciones del Derecho Internacional Humanitario, abund√≥ el Embajador Gerardo Pe√±alver Portal, viceministro primero de Relaciones Exteriores y Representante Permanente de Cuba ante las Naciones Unidas, durante la reuni√≥n plenaria del Comit√© para el Ejercicio de los Derechos Inalienables del Pueblo Palestino.
El diplom√°tico cubano asever√≥ que la terrible situaci√≥n que enfrenta el pueblo palestino no se vislumbra mejor en tanto Israel, la Potencia Ocupante, contin√∫a arremetiendo con bombas y misiles contra la poblaci√≥n indefensa en Gaza y aplicando su ‚Äúfilosof√≠a del despojo‚Äù.
Denunci√≥ la impunidad con que act√∫a el gobierno de Israel y consider√≥ inaceptable que el Consejo de Seguridad contin√∫e sin hacer cumplir sus propias resoluciones para poner fin a los cr√≠menes de Israel, de los que Estados Unidos ha sido c√≥mplice hist√≥ricamente, al obstruir y usar el veto de manera reiterada para impedir la acci√≥n del √≥rgano, socavando la paz, la seguridad y la estabilidad regionales.
‚ÄúSeguiremos llamando al Consejo de Seguridad a cumplir con la responsabilidad que le otorga la Carta en el mantenimiento de la paz y la seguridad internacionales y adoptar las medidas necesarias por parte de Israel‚Äù, expres√≥.
El vicecanciller cubano reiter√≥ el apoyo de Cuba a la demanda de Sud√°frica ante la Corte Internacional de Justicia en relaci√≥n con las violaciones por parte de Israel de sus obligaciones como Estado Parte en la Convenci√≥n para la Prevenci√≥n y la Sanci√≥n del Delito de Genocidio, de 1948.
Este procedimiento, refiri√≥ Pe√±alver Portal, debe ser tambi√©n entendido y atendido como un llamado urgente a detener los horribles cr√≠menes internacionales de genocidio, lesa humanidad y apartheid que se cometen contra el pueblo palestino.
(Cubaminrex-Misi√≥n Permanente de Cuba ante las Naciones Unidas)
Informaci√≥n relacionada:
Declaraci√≥n del Embajador Gerardo Pe√±alver Portal, viceministro primero de Relaciones Exteriores y Representante Permanente de Cuba ante las Naciones Unidas, durante la 415ta reuni√≥n plenaria del Comit√© para el Ejercicio de los Derechos Inalienables del Pueblo Palestino.
Nueva York, 31 de enero de 2024.
Se√±or presidente:
Deseo ante todo expresar nuestro reconocimiento a la presencia del Secretario General de la ONU al frente de la reuni√≥n del Comit√©. Ello es una nueva expresi√≥n de su continuo apoyo y preocupaci√≥n por lograr que las Naciones Unidas tengan un papel relevante en la soluci√≥n de la catastr√≥fica situaci√≥n que se vive hoy en el territorio palestino ocupado, as√≠ como en el largo conflicto que afecta cada d√≠a m√°s la paz y la seguridad internacionales, y que tiene como v√≠ctimas inmediatas al heroico y sufrido pueblo palestino.
Agradecemos la informaci√≥n que ha presentado el Ministro Mansour, las actualizaciones del Organismo de Obras P√∫blicas y Socorro de las Naciones Unidas para los Refugiados de Palestina en el Cercano Oriente (UNRWA), as√≠ como la presentaci√≥n realizada por la distinguida Representante Permanente de Sud√°frica ante Naciones Unidas.
Nuestra felicitaci√≥n al estimado Embajador Representante Permanente de Senegal, Cheikh Niang, por su relecci√≥n al frente del Comit√©.
Se√±or Presidente:
La comunidad internacional es testigo del genocidio que se perpetra contra el pueblo palestino desde hace ya varios meses.
La terrible situaci√≥n que enfrenta el pueblo palestino no se vislumbra mejor, sino que, por el contrario, Israel, la Potencia Ocupante, contin√∫a arremetiendo con bombas y misiles contra la poblaci√≥n indefensa en Gaza y aplicando su ‚Äúfilosof√≠a del despojo‚Äù, con lo cual ha provocado una cat√°strofe humanitaria de proporciones extremas en el territorio palestino ilegalmente ocupado durante 75 a√±os.
Nada puede justificar semejante barbarie. Demandamos el cese al fuego inmediato y permanente, as√≠ como la entrega de ayuda humanitaria a Gaza sin restricciones.
Cuba condena, en los t√©rminos m√°s en√©rgicos los asesinatos de civiles, especialmente de mujeres, ni√±os y de trabajadores humanitarios del sistema de Naciones Unidas; los bombardeos indiscriminados contra la poblaci√≥n en Gaza y la destrucci√≥n de viviendas, hospitales e infraestructura civil; as√≠ como la privaci√≥n de los servicios de agua, alimentos, electricidad y combustible a la poblaci√≥n palestina. Esas acciones constituyen flagrantes violaciones del Derecho Internacional Humanitario.
Se impone detener el desplazamiento forzoso de los palestinos de la tierra que por derecho propio les pertenece. Rechazamos todas las acciones de las fuerzas israel√≠es en la Cisjordania ocupada, que han recrudecido la represi√≥n y los asesinatos de los palestinos que la habitan, en franca violaci√≥n del Derecho Internacional.
Debe cesar la impunidad con que act√∫a el gobierno de Israel, que solo puede explicarse por su confianza en que no tendr√° que rendir cuentas por sus actos, en tanto cuenta con el respaldo del gobierno de los Estados Unidos y de otros aliados en la OTAN.
Es inaceptable que el Consejo de Seguridad contin√∫e sin hacer cumplir sus propias resoluciones para poner fin a los cr√≠menes de Israel, de los que Estados Unidos ha sido c√≥mplice hist√≥ricamente, al obstruir y usar el veto de manera reiterada para impedir la acci√≥n del √≥rgano, socavando la paz, la seguridad y la estabilidad regionales.
Seguiremos llamando al Consejo de Seguridad a cumplir con la responsabilidad que le otorga la Carta en el mantenimiento de la paz y la seguridad internacionales y adoptar las medidas necesarias por parte de Israel.
En el contexto de la XIX Cumbre del MNOAL, Cuba propuso que el Movimiento apoye el env√≠o urgente a la Franja de Gaza de una Misi√≥n de Protecci√≥n Internacional, autorizada por la Asamblea G‚Ä¶
(Cubaminrex-Misi√≥n Permanente de Cuba ante las Naciones Unidas)

author: Casey Young
title: Megan Moroney To Release Fan-Favorite Song ‚ÄúNo Caller ID‚Äù This Month | Whiskey Riff
text: Finally‚Ä¶ [Megan Moroney](http://whiskeyriff.com/tag/meg-moroney) confirmed that she has a new single dropping this month, one she‚Äôs been teasing out on the road for quite a while now called [‚ÄúNo Caller ID.‚Äù](https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2023/12/22/megan-moroney-teases-another-new-song-no-caller-id/) The breakup song has a really unique concept, which finds Meg‚Äôs ex finding new ways to contact her, though through the verses in the song, she eventually realizes she‚Äôs moved on enough and doesn‚Äôt want to pick up the call with ‚Äúno caller ID‚Äù anymore. She shared a teaser of the studio cut over on TikTok earlier, and I think it‚Äôs such a great song that I can‚Äôt wait to hear in its entirety, in the form it will likely be included in on the next record. A fan in the comments asked her if she‚Äôd ‚Äúrelease soon,‚Äù and Meg replied: ‚ÄúHow about this month?‚Äù We don‚Äôt have an exact date quite yet, but seeing as we‚Äôre already almost one week into January, I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll have to wait too much longer: Check it out: [@megmoroney]ft the waterbugs üòé [#nocallerID] [‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Megan Moroney] Meg also perviously noted that she‚Äôs [‚Äúalmost done‚Äù](https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2023/12/18/megan-moroney-teases-heartbreaker-called-28th-of-june-says-shes-almost-done-writing-next-album/) writing her second album, and teased another unreleased song a few weeks back called ‚Äú28th of June‚Äù that is equally as beautiful, and I hope to get to hear on her sophomore project: Today, the Georgia native released a perfect cover of Chris Stapleton‚Äôs supremely underrated deep cut [‚ÄúWhat Are You Listening To?‚Äù](https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2024/01/05/megan-moroney-releases-perfect-studio-cover-of-chris-stapletons-what-are-you-listening-to/)

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - LG developed a two-legged AI-powered robot that can watch your pets for you
text:
Summary by Ground News LG is going to start selling a compact bipedal robot that can roll around your house freely. The AI-powered robot, which will debut at CES 2024 in Las Vegas, has a wide range of capabilities. It can recognize faces and voices, process the emotions of those around it and engage in conversation. Share menu More
